intro: Boophone haemanthoides subsp. haemanthoides, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fiery red bracts that surround its small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of long, narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces tubers underground for storage. This species is popular in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
